Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc:
Instrument Overview =================== The PPSTOKE instrument is used to indicate those polarimetry results reported to the Photometry and Polarimetry Network (PPN) of the International Halley Watch (IHW) as Stokes parameters.
In fact, by the end of the IHW mission only one instrument was actually used to collect data reported in this format: tje Meudon PPHR (rotating half wave plate) at the ESO 1.52m telescope.
Filters ======= IHW documentation is not clear on this point. The original (i.e., version 1.0) catalog file for this instrument contained the following statement:
Although observers were encouraged to use the standard IHW narrow band filter set (H2O+, OH, C2, C3, CN, UCNT, BCNT,and RCNT) in this case there was no filter at all.
However, each and every record associated with this instrument reported a filter with a central wavelength of 4950 Angstroms, with a FWHM of 2800 Angstroms.
